672306468.name: Great place to see a game
672306468.author: a TripAdvisor user
672306468.reviewBody: The stadium is very clean, and has great view all over the stadium...but beware, it can get very cold at nights.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles s/n

602798430.name: Do not pay \u201cBife sports\u201d restaurant
602798430.author: a TripAdvisor user
602798430.reviewBody: Do not pay $900 pesos. Service is terrible, portions are small. I ordered Waffle Potato and it had 9 slices only. You can\u2019t watch the game, it is not a good spot to see the entire field, because you miss half the pitch on less you book on time.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles s/n

487816447.name: Pachuca Tuzos won the Concacaf championship!!!
487816447.author: a TripAdvisor user
487816447.reviewBody: Once again the TUZOS won the chance to represent Mexico at the FIFA WORLD CLUB CHAMPIONSHIP!!! Go TUZOS GO!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles s/n

437519093.name: The Home of the Tuzos (Gophers)
437519093.author: a TripAdvisor user
437519093.reviewBody: The Oldest Team in proffessional football in  Mexico has already secured a place in this season play offs. "Hidalgo Stadium" is one of the few places where people can enjoy a game, bringing their small children with the utmost confidence without the fear of being assaulted by rival team\'s supporters.\nAdelante Tuzos!!!\n(FIRST two pictures, and the last one,taken in the old "Revoluci\u00f3n Stadium")

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles s/n

658910537.name: Pleasant surprise
658910537.author: a TripAdvisor user
658910537.reviewBody: The ground mural by Byron G\u00e1lvez Avil\u00e9s is spectacular. Just the idea of having an art piece that is so close to people and their everyday life is amazing. There is a great atmosphere about this place and I love that people of Pachuca have such a place to enjoy their leisure time.

address.streetAddress: Camino Real de la Plata

551162733.name: Creativity
551162733.author: a TripAdvisor user
551162733.reviewBody: It\u2019s like a long mural in the floor and the creativity of it calls your attention. It\u2019s made with pastel colors and it\u2019s just a great place for pictures. It can also be a romantic spot for couples. Just chill and talk!

address.streetAddress: Camino Real de la Plata

417737879.name: A night at the Camino Real to watch the Pisal at David Ben Gurion Park
417737879.author: a TripAdvisor user
417737879.reviewBody: Look at a review of the Hotel Camino Real in Pachuca to find my impressions on the floor mural (Pisal) at the park.

address.streetAddress: Camino Real de la Plata

339743068.name: Monumental Spot in Pachuca
339743068.author: a TripAdvisor user
339743068.reviewBody: This is a must if visiting Pachuca, Hidalgo. There isn\'t much to do here, but it\'s next to a library and the Soccer Museum. This area is great for pictures!

address.streetAddress: Camino Real de la Plata

249022089.name: Beautiful
249022089.author: a TripAdvisor user
249022089.reviewBody: If you are in Pachuca, you must go to David Ben Guri\u00f3n Park. The construction is very beautiful and the big mosaic on the ground is fascinating! You can still visit the Museo del Futbol.

address.streetAddress: Camino Real de la Plata

340748294.name: One of a kind Museum and exhibits
340748294.author: a TripAdvisor user
340748294.reviewBody: If you are a soccer fan and travel with family you won\'t find another  place like this. It houses at the Salo de la Fama not only  the history and memorabilia of the Football Soccer since its beginnings. Also El Mundo del Futbol offers and intercative center for all ages.

address.streetAddress: Fraccion 1, Super Manzana Iii, Cluster 4, Lote 15, Zona Plateada

329984765.name: This place is fun for the soccer lover!
329984765.author: a TripAdvisor user
329984765.reviewBody: My family and I spent a few hours in this place. The best is the Human Metegol! I really didn\'t want to leave this game.

address.streetAddress: Fraccion 1, Super Manzana Iii, Cluster 4, Lote 15, Zona Plateada

662481054.name: Lamas un a car window
662481054.author: a TripAdvisor user
662481054.reviewBody: Safari on the car was great. Bring a lot of carrots with you to feed all animals, because it\'s crazy expensive to buy it there, and you will need a lot of carrots. Lamas are very hungry and impudent \ud83d\ude01

address.streetAddress: Camino Rural Rancho San Pablo S/N

567084418.name: Visit with the family
567084418.author: a TripAdvisor user
567084418.reviewBody: A wonderful place to take the kids.  It is a safari type zoo.  Have a great number of animals.  Very moderately priced. Of the common zoo animals there are no elephants.

address.streetAddress: Camino Rural Rancho San Pablo S/N

556145015.name: Judging without knowing
556145015.author: a TripAdvisor user
556145015.reviewBody: At first I looked this place up and saw the exhibits offered and I was like, "meh, it doesn\'t look good enough." I also thought it was very small and that it would be done in about an hour or so but I was wrong. I decided to go with family and it was a 40 min drive from where I was staying at. I recommend you to take food for yourself in anticipation because there is not much variety in food there, The safari is located in a small town. I loved the animals, most of them looked well. It was a fun experience having the animals put their head inside the car for you to feed them. Try to bring your own carrots since it\'s just logical. You may buy carrots over there but you\'ll end up wasting for money because it\'s just fun giving the animals food. The place is bigger than I thought and has great variety. It took us about 3 hours to complete it. The only  let down I had was that Tuzoofari had a sign of Church\'s Chicken and I was excited to eat there one I was done. As a result it turned out it was taken down and just sign remained. But overall, I enjoyed it. It should definitely have more visits.

address.streetAddress: Camino Rural Rancho San Pablo S/N

425692410.name: So much fun!
425692410.author: a TripAdvisor user
425692410.reviewBody: Was told that it was one of the \'sad\' zoos in Mexico. I really enjoyed it. The hippos were sad with their living conditions. Just dirty and small but all the other animals seemed good. Drive through park. The zebra want to be feed but don\'t feed them!

address.streetAddress: Camino Rural Rancho San Pablo S/N

377342160.name: Sad place to visit
377342160.author: a TripAdvisor user
377342160.reviewBody: I dont like it .. animals shouldnt be there... I dont think they have the attention they need. It is so sad to them there

address.streetAddress: Camino Rural Rancho San Pablo S/N

353170410.name: Better than the safaris in Texas
353170410.author: a TripAdvisor user
353170410.reviewBody: Huge safari and many exotic animals, but seems like several of them lack essentials like water and food. Entrance fee is reasonable and so is the food to purchase to feed the animals. They have ligers here and I saw some in the making! Had a good time here and will come back.

address.streetAddress: Camino Rural Rancho San Pablo S/N

583466635.name: Breathtaking Views
583466635.author: a TripAdvisor user
583466635.reviewBody: Why would you not go here? It is free and beautiful. The views of the city are breathtaking. Just a lovely sight in Higaldo State.

address.streetAddress: Antigua Carretera a Mineral del Monte

507857988.name: Go for the views of Pachuca
507857988.author: a TripAdvisor user
507857988.reviewBody: As a statue of Jesus Christ, it\'s pretty ugly.  But, go because it\'s free and the views of the town of Pachuca are amazing!  If you have a car, it\'s pretty easy to get to.  I\'m not sure if there is public transportation to the site.

address.streetAddress: Antigua Carretera a Mineral del Monte

387637085.name: Cannot miss for soccer fans!!
387637085.author: a TripAdvisor user
387637085.reviewBody: My entire family enjoyed the experience even the ones that are not big soccer fans.  This was a guided tour where a young man in our case enthusiastically told the story about football developed into an international game and lead us through the tour.  It was a great place to see but the guide added a lot to the experience.  In addition to the guide\'s commentary they had 2 small theaters one showing highlights of international soccer and the other showing Mexican soccer.  They also had an interactive area where kids could measure skills versus the top players in the game. They had a studio where everybody could try play by play skills or try to be a studio anchor or commentator. At the end they a had a small stadium where you could actually organize a pick up game. Of course to see the hall of fame is a great experience on its own.

itemReviewed.name: Salon de la Fama del Futbol Internacional

address.streetAddress: Zona Plateada, Mz3 Clauster IV , Parque David Ben Gurion Zona Plateada

674002127.name: The best vacations
674002127.author: a TripAdvisor user
674002127.reviewBody: Hidalgo is one of the best experiences you can have when visiting a magical town,In Pachuca we find a very cool climate and very friendly people. If you visit this place with the right people you will have an unforgettable vacation.

address.streetAddress: Jardin independencia

643843885.name: Small town
643843885.author: a TripAdvisor user
643843885.reviewBody: Went to visit Pachuca, a small town in Hidalgo. The city centre was pretty nice and had a market at xmas time

address.streetAddress: Jardin independencia

673999525.name: the mini nig ben
673999525.author: a TripAdvisor user
673999525.reviewBody: found it a surprising place, it is very nice and if you come to Pachuca you should definitely visit it, the businesses around are nice and the people are very friendly with the tourists, especially if you are a foreigner, I had a wonderful experience and without a doubt I must return some day.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

672637530.name: Amazing clock
672637530.author: a TripAdvisor user
672637530.reviewBody: Looking back in time and wondering how this magnificent clock keeps ticking the 21st century real time. A master piece that is very well kept and is the icon of  Pachuca\'s city center.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

654074986.name: Iconic and beautiful
654074986.author: a TripAdvisor user
654074986.reviewBody: If you are in Pachuca, you should go downtown to visit this building. It is beautiful. It has been there for more than 100 years. Pictures are perfect from any side you. Besides, you can see the mountains that cover the city. You can also  walk around and sometimes be lucky to find hand-crafted items from the State.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

653494649.name: Take the long tour!!!
653494649.author: a TripAdvisor user
653494649.reviewBody: Is really worth it to take the long tour, they take you to the outside and explains all the arquitectural aspects and history of the clock, then you go up all the way to the top we\u2019re is all the bells, keep in mind is going to be some exercise involve; but is a unique experience.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

652394808.name: English influence
652394808.author: a TripAdvisor user
652394808.reviewBody: The clock is very nice to see and is a landmark of a time when the english were here. Apart from the clock they left a tasty empanda like food called pastes. The weather is also a bit windy here, but nice.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

619252325.name: Lovely town!
619252325.author: a TripAdvisor user
619252325.reviewBody: The weather is incredible fresh! always windy! the old clock is in between beautiful views!\nvery nice people, don\'t forget to eat Pastes you can find them everywhere!

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

605472616.name: Typical Small Town center
605472616.author: a TripAdvisor user
605472616.reviewBody: There is nothing monumental about the clock. If this were any other city it would just be a "clock". As far as things to do, this probably takes up 30 minutes of your day if you stop for ice cream.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

590111271.name: Old clock tower
590111271.author: a TripAdvisor user
590111271.reviewBody: Told that this is same manufacturer than Big Ben. Not sure if it is , but possible. Located just in center of older city

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

583477128.name: Incredible!
583477128.author: a TripAdvisor user
583477128.reviewBody: We took the stairs upstairs inside the clock. Well worth it for the beautiful views of the city of Pachuca. Well worth the few peso admittance.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

569895935.name: Interesting but dangerous to go to top!
569895935.author: a TripAdvisor user
569895935.reviewBody: We found the Reloj to be interesting but it is an extremely dangerous climb to the top with several ladders. Be warned! Not for the claustrophobic!

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

567084119.name: Interesting Landmark
567084119.author: a TripAdvisor user
567084119.reviewBody: This is an interesting landmark because it is the only real clock tower in Mexico. Donated to Pachuca by the English who took over the mines here years ago.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

562427068.name: "Just a cool place to visit"
562427068.author: a TripAdvisor user
562427068.reviewBody:
Pachuca is a city in central Mexico. The Monumental Clock is a neoclassical
tower in the main square, Plaza Independencia. Set in the Ex-Convento de San Francisco.

The Cuartel del Arte cultural center is home to a baroque church, art gallery
and the Fototeca Nacional photo library. The Museo de Minería traces the region's
mining history. The International Football Hall of Fame honors soccer's 
greatest players.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

549137302.name: Art in the midst of Pachuca
549137302.author: a TripAdvisor user
549137302.reviewBody: Wow, truly beautiful monument. I love it\u2019s proportion and design. It\u2019s posture is perfect in the center. It definitely calls for attention. It\u2019s centered in a plaza, meaning there are many restaurants and shops around it. You\u2019ll definitely maintain yourself busy. I went during the holiday season so it is packed with people but it\u2019s enjoyable. It\u2019s enjoyable if you appreciate the mexican culture.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

515967905.name: Beautiful city center, lots to do around here
515967905.author: a TripAdvisor user
515967905.reviewBody: This was my fourth time here and as always it is fun place to visit. There are great places to shop and eat all around and near the plaza. Sometimes there\'s musicians, dancing or various kinds of entertainment going on near the Reloj.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

507856664.name: Iconic symbol of the city
507856664.author: a TripAdvisor user
507856664.reviewBody: I love the Reloj.  It is beautiful and the plaza and surrounding buildings are really charming.  Also, in case you were worried, it is a very safe area, with lots of families and people going about their business.  There are music groups playing some evenings, kids skating and skateboarding, vendors hawking their wares, young lovers meeting up, it\'s just a really great place to sit and people-watch.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

471283771.name: I\'m in the moment of time
471283771.author: a TripAdvisor user
471283771.reviewBody: The time has been very helpful and too much for the greatest thing in life but I\'m sure it will be there for the greatest thing in life but it is the best way to get a chance to look at the city and stay safe

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

464994526.name: Stands for itself
464994526.author: a TripAdvisor user
464994526.reviewBody: It calls for attention at the center of a mini outside plaza. The architecture of this monument is mesmerizing. About the location; there are many stores to shop at. They\'re all around it and even have a variety of food choices.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

463247486.name: Downtown
463247486.author: a TripAdvisor user
463247486.reviewBody: Very nice buildings around downtown.\nClean and beautiful, we enjoy the city and the food,\nThe weather was very pleasant.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

430333586.name: Been through multiple restorations
430333586.author: a TripAdvisor user
430333586.reviewBody: The monument is in much better shape since my first visit almost 10 years ago. It really set off the downtown square nicely!

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

427248846.name: A must-see landmark in Pachuca
427248846.author: a TripAdvisor user
427248846.reviewBody: The clock tower is really stunning - worth seeing both by day and in the evening when it\'s lit like a jewel. Didn\'t get to take a tour, but would love to some day!

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

415794831.name: Pachuca, real del monte prismas trip in one day
415794831.author: a TripAdvisor user
415794831.reviewBody:
I recommend you go to Pachuca Hidaldo and visit the "Reloj Monumental". Then go to real del monte and "Prismas Basalticos" in one day. 

Reloj Monumental is beautiful.
If the Reloj is open, GO. You can visit the inside of the Reloj and learn how it works and all the history around it. You will love it.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

352752302.name: Will the Retrofit be a Success?
352752302.author: a TripAdvisor user
352752302.reviewBody:
The plaza has been under re-construction for almost a year and officials say it will re-open in April - no year mentioned. 

Currently it is surrounded by metal shrouding so zero street level visibility and the clock tower lower section is wrapped for protection.

Locals we spoke to indicate many are unhappy with the plan as it removed all the trees and vegetation from the previous park space replacing it with hard surfaces.  The present work site is a big eyesore in Centro.  Hope the finished product will be acceptable to the naysayers.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

330062825.name: GREAT MONUMENT!
330062825.author: a TripAdvisor user
330062825.reviewBody: This clock is amazingly beatiful! It was just cleaned when we visited the city of Pachuca! A must see!

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

224695727.name: Great location in town
224695727.author: a TripAdvisor user
224695727.reviewBody: It was fun to go here, very beautiful clock tower. If you go inside look for the bus tour, takes about an hour and it\'s in Spanish, but it is very cool and worth the small price.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

201727224.name: An authentic pice of History
201727224.author: a TripAdvisor user
201727224.reviewBody: This is the crown jewel in our small city and state capital. It has the same machinery as the Big Ben. It was recently restored so it looks as it has just been built. Every hour a part of the Mexican National Anthem is played.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

185910952.name: Clock
185910952.author: a TripAdvisor user
185910952.reviewBody: The clock is situated in the downtown of the city and it\'s very beautiful it was constructed in 1906 and finished in 1910, there are many ways to arrive there and it\'s definitely a MUST in Pachuca.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

169668736.name: Beautiful clock
169668736.author: a TripAdvisor user
169668736.reviewBody: I live in this town, the population is close 500,000 people, its a busy and thriving community. The clock was refurbshised about two years ago so, it is in pristine condition. They say the internal workings of the clock was manufactured by the same company that made Big Ben clock in London. England. The clock is situated in the town square which has a couple of quite unique hotels one of which is the hotel Emily. The Emily is beautifully decorated with some of the rooms boasting balconies looking on to the town square. On a Friday evening they have music from the 50\'s and 60\'s eras, which attracts a lot of dancers from yesteryear in beautiful suits and dresses from that time. This attaction is worth visiting as well is the town square which has some nice Mexican restuarants. Pachuca is about 90 mins from the main Mexican airport. There is an airport bus that for the equivilent of $15 will take you directly to Pachuca. There is also a little gondola bus that parks in the town square that will take you to fantastic Jesus statue up in the mountains that is quite spectacular. This statue resembles the famous statue in Rio De Janeiro it is quite breathtaking and the tranquilty on that mountain has a definite feel of another presence. Pachuca was originally a mining town that mined silver. The early inhabitants arrived from England in the 1600 to mine the bountiful silver. The town has the famous cornish pastie which was brought from the early settlers. The weather in Pachuca is a mixed bag being 7000 ft above sealevel it can be quite cool, the average temperature hovers around the high seventies in the summer with little or no humidity. In the winter December January February it can get quire cold with frost early in the mornings. All in all a beautiful little town with a great temperate climate.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Independencia

510239873.name: Small, historic, nice place
510239873.author: a TripAdvisor user
510239873.reviewBody: The place is so well kept that deserves a mention, very good job. When we went is was displayed an Anthropological Exposition of the North of Mexico Native Groups, enlightening.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Aniceto Ortega s/n

466770993.name: Large space in repurposed old building
466770993.author: a TripAdvisor user
466770993.reviewBody: Your experience here will depend on what the particular exhibition is at the time.  I didn\'t think it was worthwhile at all; but go and see what they have.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Aniceto Ortega s/n

377340626.name: Love the expo
377340626.author: a TripAdvisor user
377340626.reviewBody: So far I\'ve visited 3 different expositions and I think they were great.  the city needs more places like this.

address.streetAddress: Plaza Aniceto Ortega s/n

550789790.name: Great photo exhibitions worth about an hour of your time
550789790.author: a TripAdvisor user
550789790.reviewBody: I had a great time visiting this museum while visiting Pachuca for a day. It\'s an hour or so kind of visit while strolling around the town. There were some wonderful historic photos of the mines of Pachuca and others from around the state of Hidalgo. Definitely check it out when you\'re in town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Casasola (C Del Hospital) s/n Exconvento de San Francisco, Col. Centro

510243873.name: You must go
510243873.author: a TripAdvisor user
510243873.reviewBody: Very important place because it houses the Casasola Archives, one of the largest pictures collection in Mexico. They display a few dozens at a time and it is located besides the Cuartel del Arte, so you can make a combo and visit both.

address.streetAddress: Calle Casasola (C Del Hospital) s/n Exconvento de San Francisco, Col. Centro

472775631.name: Must visit
472775631.author: a TripAdvisor user
472775631.reviewBody: The whole area is very nice with a church and another museum, as well as the national photo archives. A nice courtyard.

address.streetAddress: Calle Casasola (C Del Hospital) s/n Exconvento de San Francisco, Col. Centro

466771254.name: Some interesting photos
466771254.author: a TripAdvisor user
466771254.reviewBody: A wide range of photos is on view.  I\'m guessing most of these are on permanent exhibition, or maybe they switch them out from their huge collection.  In any case, some are of historical interest.

address.streetAddress: Calle Casasola (C Del Hospital) s/n Exconvento de San Francisco, Col. Centro

668347743.name: Incre\u00edble
668347743.author: a TripAdvisor user
668347743.reviewBody: Incre\u00edble lugar para ir con toda la familia, gran colecci\u00f3n de dioramas y eventos para todas las edades, clases de combates medievales y disfraces para sesi\u00f3n de fotos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alamo 700, El Tezontle Atraz Zona Plateada

655298964.name: Miles de miniaturas!
655298964.author: a TripAdvisor user
655298964.reviewBody: Un incre\u00edble castillo de dragones (que de verdad tiene un drag\u00f3n) con miles de miniaturas dentro que vale mucho la pena visitar, ferias, peque\u00f1os ej\u00e9rcitos, escenarios marinos, el castillo de Dr\u00e1cula, un teatro o una funci\u00f3n de cine con Charles chaplin, s\u00faper!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alamo 700, El Tezontle Atraz Zona Plateada

655056145.name: Miles de miniaturas
655056145.author: a TripAdvisor user
655056145.reviewBody: 150 dioramas elaborados a mano, \u00fanicos, los temas son las artes y oficios antiguos, no te imaginas las sorpresas que un grupo de pachuque\u00f1os tienen reservada para ti con esta colecci\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alamo 700, El Tezontle Atraz Zona Plateada

658909917.name: Bad organization ruins the experience
658909917.author: a TripAdvisor user
658909917.reviewBody: The tour would have been more enjoyable if you don\u2019t come in stressed because there is no parking and they made you wait for the tour. There is no schedule of tours and you can not do it on your own. The tour itself is good if you want an introduction to how the life of a miner was back then. The guide was very informative. You do not go down into a mine, but into a maintenance tunnel.

itemReviewed.name: Museo De Sitio Mina De Acosta

address.streetAddress: Mineral del Monte

638224510.name: Un lugar sencillo
638224510.author: a TripAdvisor user
638224510.reviewBody: Es un lugar sencillo, tranquilo, para una caminata amena en familia. No es muy grande y no hay mucha variedad de plantas.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

631801635.name: Si eres amante de la naturaleza este es tu lugar
631801635.author: a TripAdvisor user
631801635.reviewBody: Para visitar en familia con los ni\u00f1os, o con amigos.\nRecorrer sus veredas, visitar los puntos de informaci\u00f3n, nos ense\u00f1an como se puede reutilizar el pl\u00e1stico, nos muestran una casa ecol\u00f3gica. Toda una aventura.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

621059054.name: Parque did\u00e1ctico, ideal para caminatas
621059054.author: a TripAdvisor user
621059054.reviewBody: Este parque est\u00e1 algo escondido pero vale la pena visitarlo si se tienen ni\u00f1os, hay varias actividades para ellos como ver el serpentario, visitar la granja, explorar el laberinto de arbustos y conocer m\u00e1s sobre las plantas y animales locales. Hay poca gente generalmente. Tambi\u00e9n es buena opci\u00f3n para hacer caminata o correr por las ma\u00f1anas, tiene un sendero adecuado. Incluso hay \u00e1reas con mesas para un d\u00eda de campo con familia. Adem\u00e1s casi todas las actividades son gratis.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

570293913.name: Un lugar did\u00e1ctico y divertido para ni\u00f1os
570293913.author: a TripAdvisor user
570293913.reviewBody: Lo he visitado varias veces con ni\u00f1os, ellos aprenden y se divierten mucho. Es importante este tipo de espacios para que las nuevas generaciones hagan conciencia.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

500789501.name: Lugar ideal para hacer ejercicio
500789501.author: a TripAdvisor user
500789501.reviewBody: Est\u00e1 genial el parque para correr por las ma\u00f1anas, adem\u00e1s se cuida de la naturaleza. Falta vigilancia

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

479785090.name: Muy solitario, le falta difusi\u00f3n...
479785090.author: a TripAdvisor user
479785090.reviewBody: Un lugar interesante que luce abandonado y en donde la atenci\u00f3n es nula pues pr\u00e1cticamente no hay nadie para orientar.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

431226818.name: Divertido y gratis!!!
431226818.author: a TripAdvisor user
431226818.reviewBody: Es un parque que ofrece varias actividades para realizar, esta muy enfocado al cuidado del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales. Es una excelente opci\u00f3n para ir acompa\u00f1ado de ni\u00f1os que podr\u00e1n jugar y divertirse al mismo tiempo que aprenden como respetar y cuidar su entorno.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Segura No. 100 Col. Adolfo Lopez Mateos

668469371.name: Muy bueno!!
668469371.author: a TripAdvisor user
668469371.reviewBody: Bastante entretenido, los ni\u00f1os se divierten mucho, es algo peque\u00f1o, pero muy bien, vale la pena, tiene el dinopark muy bueno, algo recomendable para toda la familia!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

666914234.name: Divertido
666914234.author: a TripAdvisor user
666914234.reviewBody: Una buena opci\u00f3n de entretenimiento. Los j\u00f3venes que atienden y guian tienen muy buena actitud de servicio.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

658344412.name: Dinosaurios \ud83e\udd95
658344412.author: a TripAdvisor user
658344412.reviewBody: Si tu hijo est\u00e1 en la edad del gusto por los dinosaurios...no debes dejar de ir, aunque lo recorres muy r\u00e1pido la calidad de las figuras y lo educativo que resulta para los ni\u00f1os es genial. Vete preparado con gorras y bloqueador porque el sol est\u00e1 dur\u00edsimo en este mes. El jard\u00edn bot\u00e1nico y la zona arqueol\u00f3gica est\u00e1 bonita tambi\u00e9n. Ya estando ah\u00ed aprovecha para entrar al museo no importa la edad de tu hijo, hay una zona de preescolar, de ciencias, de arte, de tecnolog\u00eda y en cualquiera de van a divertir. Muy recomendable tambi\u00e9n pasar a la funci\u00f3n que den en el planetario est\u00e1 muy acondicionado y todo se ve espectacular.\nY los precios son muy accesibles!!! No te lo pierdas!!! \ud83d\ude0a\nEl \u00fanico pero es que en la tienda de recuerdos del dinoparque no aceptan tarjeta as\u00ed que lleva efectivo si piensas comprar algo!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

654874408.name: Sencillo, bonito y educativo
654874408.author: a TripAdvisor user
654874408.reviewBody: Buen\u00edsima opci\u00f3n para divertirse y de paso conocer y educarse en diferentes temas en familia. El Dinoparque est\u00e1 muy padre y muy bien hecho, felicidades al Museo El Rehilete y sus colaboradores.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

635239303.name: Dino parque, peque\u00f1o pero divertido
635239303.author: a TripAdvisor user
635239303.reviewBody: Fuimos al Dino parque que se encuentra en el museo del Rehilete y aunque es muy peque\u00f1o est\u00e1 divertido. Llev\u00e1bamos 5 ni\u00f1os de entre 3-5 a\u00f1os y para ellos fue muy interesante y divertido. Hab\u00eda exhibiciones cerradas y no hay gu\u00edas ni nadie quien explique, literal se hace el recorrido por tu cuenta. Estaba s\u00faper limpio y los dinosaurios en muy buen estado. Pero por mucho el recorrido se hace en 30min. Hay paquetes que incluyen el museo y el parque, nosotros solo entramos al parque y despu\u00e9s nos arrepentimos porque al ser un lugar tan peque\u00f1o los ni\u00f1os quer\u00edan seguir visitando pero los precios por separado es mucho dinero. En fin nos gusto el lugar, si van si recomiendo que compren boletos para ambos lugares.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

634297530.name: Aprender y divertirse
634297530.author: a TripAdvisor user
634297530.reviewBody: Un excelente lugar para pasarla en familia y aprender muchas cosas juntos de una manera muy divertida

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

632262909.name: Para divertirse en familia con los peque\u00f1os
632262909.author: a TripAdvisor user
632262909.reviewBody: Un lugar donde cuenta con un dinoparque bastante bueno para que los ni\u00f1os y no tan ni\u00f1os se diviertan y aprendan. Tambi\u00e9n existe el jard\u00edn bot\u00e1nico peque\u00f1o pero bonito y el recorrido arqueol\u00f3gico que ese si no me pareci\u00f3 muy bueno. Lo m\u00e1s interesante es el museo, tiene actividades entretenidas, divertidas e interesantes donde vale la pena traer a los ni\u00f1os a pasarla genial muy al estilo Papalote Museo del Ni\u00f1o.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

631483443.name: Muy divertido y con muchas cosas que hacer
631483443.author: a TripAdvisor user
631483443.reviewBody: Es un museo muy completo, ya que tiene muchas actividades para hacer. Puedes visitar un avi\u00f3n y sobrevolar Pachuca virtualmente, aprender sobre el universo en el planetario, pasear junto a los dinosaurios, conocer sobre arte, ciencia y tecnolog\u00eda o disfrutar del jard\u00edn bot\u00e1nico.\nLos ni\u00f1os aprenden y se divierten mucho. Es un paseo que puede durar todo el d\u00eda a un precio muy accesible.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

619004491.name: Bonito y creativo lugarpara los peque\u00f1os
619004491.author: a TripAdvisor user
619004491.reviewBody: En las vacaciones de verano visite este lugar con las nietas provenientes de Tabasco, les encanto ya que desarrollan su creatividad. Los peluches tienen buen costo

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

615797458.name: Muy buena opci\u00f3n para ir con ni\u00f1os
615797458.author: a TripAdvisor user
615797458.reviewBody: Muy buena opci\u00f3n para ir con ni\u00f1os, se divierten como locos y los adultos tambi\u00e9n. El mantenimiento es bueno y los dinosaurios muy bien echos, el jard\u00edn de atr\u00e1s tambi\u00e9n vale la pena

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

613257620.name: DINOSAURIOS Y DIVERSION
613257620.author: a TripAdvisor user
613257620.reviewBody: Un espacio, al estilo del Papalote, de gran interactividad para los peque\u00f1os; las replicas de los dinos estan muy bien hechas.  Para un sabado o domingo familiar.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

605140429.name: Muy buen museo para ir con ni\u00f1os
605140429.author: a TripAdvisor user
605140429.reviewBody: Es una copia de el papalote pero est\u00e1 muy bien montado.\nLos ni\u00f1os y adultos la pasan excelente.\nVale la pena ir

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

604439303.name: PENA AJENA
604439303.author: a TripAdvisor user
604439303.reviewBody: Si es barato y puedes pasar un agradable momento en el \u00e1rea de los Dinosaurios, pero en cuanto al REHILETE es deplorable, hasta la misma gente de Pachuca le da pena .

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

603586105.name: Experiencia para los peque\u00f1os y grandes
603586105.author: a TripAdvisor user
603586105.reviewBody: Corto pero lindo recorrido para los peque\u00f1os, introducci\u00f3n al mundo de la prehistoria, estimulante para nuestros paleont\u00f3logos !!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

596884294.name: Diversi\u00f3n para ni\u00f1os y grandes.
596884294.author: a TripAdvisor user
596884294.reviewBody: Es un museo, si, pero en el encontraras diversi\u00f3n para todas las edades. Visita obligada, donde conocer\u00e1s y te divertir\u00e1s aprendiendo de varios y diversos temas. No olviden entrar al Dinoparque y aunque no fue un wow, el jard\u00edn bot\u00e1nico y el paseo arqueol\u00f3gico tienen lo suyo.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

590089562.name: Monumental
590089562.author: a TripAdvisor user
590089562.reviewBody: Un lugar en que te permite aprender de diferentes \u00e1reas desde ciencias arte historia, lo m\u00e1s atractivo son los impresionantes dinosaurios y la ruta arqueol\u00f3gica de M\u00e9xico altamente recomendable y accesible

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

573330577.name: Dinoparque divertido para los ni\u00f1os
573330577.author: a TripAdvisor user
573330577.reviewBody: Cuenta con parqueo gratuito. Llegando te encuentras con un cami\u00f3n de bomberos. Los ni\u00f1os se pueden vestir como bomberos, subir al cami\u00f3n y hasta echar agua con la manguera.\nEntramos al Dinoparque. Los ni\u00f1os sacan fotos divertidas, participan de un taller de paleontolog\u00eda, otro en el jard\u00edn bot\u00e1nico donde aprendieron sobre murci\u00e9lagos y fabricaron uno.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

567596678.name: ocupado, en reparaci\u00f3n... mmm que decir
567596678.author: a TripAdvisor user
567596678.reviewBody: quedo como opci\u00f3n conocer este domingo el museo, sin embargo, el \u00e1rea arqueol\u00f3gica en reparaci\u00f3n que bueno, no vale la pena, ya que no ofrece nada relevante.\nLos boletos del planetario "agotados" as\u00ed que fue una decepci\u00f3n en general, lo que si vali\u00f3 la pena, fue el \u00e1rea de los dinosaurios. Ir con ni\u00f1os peque\u00f1os es la opci\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

555702589.name: Excelente y barato!
555702589.author: a TripAdvisor user
555702589.reviewBody: Me sorprend\u00ed al llegar a un lugar bien organizado con gente amable y barato. Lo recomiendo ampliamente. Nosotros llevamos comida y la comimos en la zona de cafeter\u00eda sin priblema. Lo que necesitar\u00e1n es llegar temprano para visitar el planetario, el museo y el parque de los dinosaurios. Para ni\u00f1os est\u00e1 incre\u00edble y para los adultos sacas buenas fotos y te entretienes tambi\u00e9n. Estacionamiento gratis.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

552044576.name: S\u00e1bado..31 de dic. \u00a1El museo y el dinoparque cerrados!
552044576.author: a TripAdvisor user
552044576.reviewBody: Museo y dinoparque cerrados el s\u00e1bado 31 de dic. que es d\u00eda h\u00e1bil para este tipo de empresas \u00bfno? Y en su p\u00e1gina web ning\u00fan tipo de advertencia de que estar\u00eda cerrado. Muy mal.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

541003964.name: Como si fuera el Papalote
541003964.author: a TripAdvisor user
541003964.reviewBody: Excelente lugar para poder ir a disfrutar una tarde sin preocupaciones, cuenta con muchas areas interesantes. Y el museo de los dinosaurios el cual se puede ver desde la carretera.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

537988736.name: Lugar que se debe visitar si llegas a Pachuca
537988736.author: a TripAdvisor user
537988736.reviewBody: EL museo El Rehilete, es una excelente opci\u00f3n si visitas la ciudad de Pachuca. Se encuentra en la entrada por la carretera M\u00e9xico-Pachuca. Su costo es muy accesible, incluso si viajan grupos grandes

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

530071357.name: DINOPARK
530071357.author: a TripAdvisor user
530071357.reviewBody: Hablare exclusivamente del DINOPARK el cual esta ubicado a un costado del museo, cuenta con estacionamiento gratuito. El costo de acceso es de $13.00. El museo es al aire libre y cuenta con varias figuras en tama\u00f1o real de dinosaurios. El museo cuanta con \u00e1reas de descanso, tienda de souvenir y ba\u00f1os. Sin duda es una muy buena opci\u00f3n para conocer un poco mas de los dinosaurios y para una buena sesi\u00f3n de fotos.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

522984526.name: MUY RECOMENDABLE SI VAS CON NI\u00d1OS PEQUE\u00d1OS.
522984526.author: a TripAdvisor user
522984526.reviewBody:
El museo el Rehilete es un museo parecido al Papalote Museo del Niño en la Ciudad de México pero muchísimo más barato. Para comenzar lo mas impresionante son los dinosaurios de gran tamaño. Los niños se encantan con ellos. Es al aire libre, así que si esta el día nublado lo mejor al llegar es empezar con el DInoparque, que es pequeño y lo recorrerás en alrededor de 20 a 30 minutos. 

El segundo punto es visitar las exposiciones temporales que presenta el Museo y después pasar al museo que tiene unas cuantas cosas que ver de ciencia y tecnología. Por ultimo, pasar al planetario el cual te presenta una pequeña explicación de los planetas en una mini sala, la cual esta padrisima pues ves todo en el techo.

El estacionamiento es gratuito, el Museo esta super limpio, el Dinoparque muy bien cuidado y el Planetario muy agradable. Genial si vas con niños pequeños.

Fácil forma de llegar.

Muy, muy agradable.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

486899700.name: Los ni\u00f1os ser\u00e1n los m\u00e1s agradecidos
486899700.author: a TripAdvisor user
486899700.reviewBody: El requiere es una de esas muy buenas opciones para conocer y recorrer, las distintas salas con las que cuenta son totalmente interactivas para los ni\u00f1os y por supuesto que siempre ser\u00e1 buena opci\u00f3n para distraerlos un buen rato  tiene su pantalla en la que proyectan pel\u00edculas cortas pero es buena opci\u00f3n,a un lado del rehilete est\u00e1 el parquesito de los dinosaurios y si a tus hijos les encantan se fascinar\u00e1n estando ah\u00ed, los precios son realmente c\u00f3modos y por supuesto que vale la pena conocer y recorrerlo todo...

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

478064877.name: Divertid\u00edsimo
478064877.author: a TripAdvisor user
478064877.reviewBody: Est\u00e1 muy atractivo,los dinosaurios impresionaron a mis hijos, en algunos momentos, tambi\u00e9n a m\u00ed. Nos divertimos y relajamos muy bien.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

476084557.name: Divertido
476084557.author: a TripAdvisor user
476084557.reviewBody:
El lugar está en una muy buena ubicación y fácil de llegar, tiene su estacionamiento propio y no cobran, tienes que comprar entradas diferentes para el museo interactivo y para el parque dinosaurio. 

MUSEO:
El museo cuenta con varias secciones muy divertidas, ciencia, arte, universo, tecnología y hasta un área preescolar te divertirás mucho y los niños ni se diga 

DINOPARQUE. 
Aqui solo veras figuras en tamaño real de dinosaurios, están muy bien echas y es entretenido 

INSTALACIONES 
 Las instalaciones son muy bonitas, baños propios, estacionamiento gratuito, primeros auxilio y lugares para comer y comprar cosas que por cierto tiene muy bien sabor y barato las aguas de la peletería están deliciosas

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

460483632.name: Recreativo, din\u00e1mico y familiar (para ni\u00f1os).
460483632.author: a TripAdvisor user
460483632.reviewBody:
Muy recomendable para niños pequeños...PERO para adultos no lo es tanto, el recorrido y la experiencia no es algo novedoso; falta efectos interactivos con los usuarios, es monótono el recorrido. 

Debería existir talleres y actividades un tanto recreativas, para todo tipo de publico, el día que fui los estaban reparando o construyendo, eso fue lo que nos comentaron. 

A los niños pequeños puede llegar a parecer impresionante y muy satisfactorio, por ver a un dinosaurio a escalas reales, es muy recomendable para familias con niños pequeños, no hay mucha gente y es un lugar seguro, son buenos los precios tanto en tiendas(para souvenirs) y precio de entrada.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

448846431.name: buen lugar
448846431.author: a TripAdvisor user
448846431.reviewBody: muy buen lugar para las familias con hijos el planetario es exelente con buenos precios buen lugar donde los peques se divertiran

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta

408860328.name: Un poco decepcionada
408860328.author: a TripAdvisor user
408860328.reviewBody: La p\u00e1gina web hacer pensar que el museo es mejor de lo que es en realidad. El mobiliario es un poco viejo, aunque hay cosas interesantes. El dinoparque nos gusto mucho, perfecto para tomar buenas fotos. Aun as\u00ed, creo que vale la pena darse la vuelta para que los ni\u00f1os se distraigan un rato, pues es interactivo.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Felipe Angeles Km 84.5 s/n Col. Venta Prieta
